newsitem.title: USA: Four missing in Louisiana natgas rig blowout.
newsitem.headline: Four missing in Louisiana natgas rig blowout.

text.p: Rescue crews were searching Tuesday for four workers missing after an overnight explosion and fire hit a natural gas rig in marshland adjacent to the Atchafalaya River near Morgan City, La., a U.S. Coast Guard spokesman said.

Flames were shooting 200 feet into the air and 18 of 22 workers were evacuated in the blowout at about 2330 CDT/0430 GMT on a rig operated by Denbury Management Co, Coast Guard Petty Officer Tyler Johnson said.

"The natural gas rig Mallard 52 burst into flames that were reaching 200 feet into the sky. Eighteen of 22 were evacuated, but four (people) are missing," he said. "We're searching by helicopter this morning for them."

The fire continued to burn on the rig in Little Bayou Pigeon about three miles northwest of Morgan City in Terrbonne Parish, but shipping was unaffected along the Atchafalaya River in southern Louisiana, Johnson said.
The Coast Guard expected the operator to file plans to extinguish the blaze and cap the well, he said.
